text:
More info can be found under operators on this page:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

Hello Everyone,
Can someone help me with the API of Association of a Contact with a Custom Object Instance. It is giving me a 404 response.

Hello,

Is there any convenient way to generate fake data for HubSpot test account?

Maybe there is a csv I can import?

Noting for anyone who stumbles on this thread - the docs were updated yesterday to reflect this.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>
Is accurate.

:wave: There is some sample csv files on this knowledgebase <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/set-up-your-import-file|article> with a small amount of test data under the *Sample import files* section*.*
is there a reason why the search operation is POST instead of GET?
yeah, it can certainly be done automated too, you'd just need to lookup companies by ID or Search APIs, then fill in new property values with PATCH / POST APIs
If you have more details on the overall use case and coding capabilities of the team working on it then we could give more advice

the Owner API is lame, known issue for me too, since forever ago, I posted 13 months ago same basic issue

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Getting-deal-owner-phone-number-using-API/m-p/232763>

API badly needs revamping
check licensing, and check URL of API being called, can you show what you called or we can't comment
yeah CSV / XLS import, or make some lame code that POSTs a whole ton of objects from a config file or randomness generator of some kind w/ whatever you want in them

presumably there must be a glitch in the API you are calling or how you are calling it so that it's getting demo hapikey and not yours? or can you be more specific what is going on? hard to follow your query
yeah, because you have to send a REST body to call it, and doing that w/ many HTTP clients on non-POST,PATCH often sucks or can't be done, is my prediction as an external guy who doesn't work at HS

Not sure if there is any immediate relief to offer :pensive:. 
Hoping to see some changes when the engagements overhaul happens which Zack referenced here: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1622817850193900?thread_ts=1620744128.495200&cid=C2YHAHB6K|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1622817850193900?thread_ts=1620744128.495200&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
